Bayesian Dissociation Single Case Analysis

Source: R/dissociation_bayes_single.R
dissociation_bayes_single.Rd

This function performs a Bayesian single-case analysis to assess the abnormality of a given score compared to a control group. It generates simulated distributions of scores based on the control group's mean, standard deviation, and sample size, and provides Bayesian credible intervals, p-values, and abnormality percentages.

Usage

dissociation_bayes_single(
  score,
  ctrl.mean,
  ctrl.sd,
  ctrl.n,
  conf.level = 0.95,
  direction = "lower",
  dp = 4,
  sims = 10000,
  treshold = 0.1
)

Arguments

score

Numeric value representing the score of the single case.

ctrl.mean

Numeric value representing the mean of the control group.

ctrl.sd

Numeric value representing the standard deviation of the control group.

ctrl.n

Integer value representing the sample size of the control group.

conf.level

Numeric value specifying the confidence level for the credible interval. Default is 0.95.

direction

Character string indicating the direction of the test, either "lower" or "higher". Default is "lower".

dp

Integer specifying the number of decimal places to round the results. Default is 4.

sims

Integer specifying the number of simulations to perform. Default is 10000.

treshold

Numeric value for the abnormality threshold. Default is 0.1.

Value

A list containing:

score

The original score provided.

ctrl.mean

The mean of the control group.

ctrl.sd

The standard deviation of the control group.

ctrl.n

The sample size of the control group.

conf.level

The confidence level used for the credible interval.

sims

The number of simulations performed.

treshold

The abnormality threshold used.

direction

The direction of the test ("lower" or "higher").

dp

The number of decimal places used for rounding.

df

The degrees of freedom of the control group (n-1).

ctrl.var

The variance of the control group.

z

The calculated z-score of the single case.

z.ci.lb

The lower bound of the Bayesian credible interval for the z-score.

z.ci.ub

The upper bound of the Bayesian credible interval for the z-score.

percentile

The percentile rank of the score in the control group.

p

The p-value based on the direction of the test.

p.two.tailed

The two-tailed p-value.

abn

The percentage of abnormality.

abn.ci.lb

The lower bound of the Bayesian credible interval for abnormality percentage.

abn.ci.ub

The upper bound of the Bayesian credible interval for abnormality percentage.

See also

bayestestR::hdi()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
result <- dissociation_bayes_single(
  score = 90,
  ctrl.mean = 100,
  ctrl.sd = 15,
  ctrl.n = 30,
  conf.level = 0.95,
  direction = "lower",
  dp = 4,
  sims = 10000,
  treshold = 0.1
)
print(result)
} # }
